title: Paraguay: Citi Rewards the Year's Top Microentrepreneurs
summary: Asunción, Paraguay - Citibank, via the Citi Foundation and in partnership with Avina, honored the winners of the 2013 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards on Wednesday, November 6, 2013, in a ceremony at the Citicenter building (Mcal.Lopez 3794/Cruz del Chaco, Salón Auditorio, 12th Floor). The awards were co-sponsored by Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay and La Nación newspaper.
tag-1: Paraguay: Citi Rewards the Year's Top Microentrepreneurs
tag-3: Asunción, Paraguay – Citibank, via the Citi Foundation and in partnership with Avina, honored the winners of the 2013 Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards on Wednesday, November 6, 2013, in a ceremony at the Citicenter building (Mcal.Lopez 3794/Cruz del Chaco, Salón Auditorio, 12th Floor). The awards were co-sponsored by Red de Microfinanzas del Paraguay and La Nación newspaper.
tag-4: The Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards is a global program Citi offers in more than 30 countries around the world. To date, more than US$5.5 million in prize money has been awarded to nearly 5,000 microentrepreneurs, and another US$12 million to microfinance institutions to support the winners' projects. Its goal is to promote entrepreneurship by recognizing the role of microentrepreneurs in economic growth and sustainability. The sector is estimated to include more than 1.2 million small businesses employing approximately 66 percent of the country's workforce.
tag-5: "This year, as we celebrate our 55th anniversary in this country, we are extremely proud to continue offering this award, strengthening a sector of the national economy that makes such an enormous contribution to the development and well-being of so many Paraguayan families," commented Jerónimo Nasser, Citi's General Manager in Paraguay.
tag-6: Eduardo Rotela, the head of Avina in Paraguay, hailed this type of initiative for identifying and rewarding successful examples of entrepreneurship, raising awareness of the sector's role in the country's economic and social development and of microfinance as a tool for development and reducing poverty.
tag-7: The award targets formal microenterprises that have a credit history with microfinance institutions. Such institutions were the only ones able to nominate this year's candidates, which included 180 enterprises in such varied sectors as clothing manufacture, retail, handcrafts, veneering and painting, hospitality, food production, leather and metalworking, and appliance sales.
tag-9: More than US$15,000 in prize money will be awarded to help the winning microentrepreneurs strengthen their businesses. The winners' credit advisors received a tablet computer.
tag-10: The following microfinance institutions submitted nominations this year: Cooperativa Medalla Milagrosa, Financiera El Comercio, Fundación Paraguaya, Interfisa, Visión Banco, and Crédito Agrícola de Habilitación. They presented projects from around the country, including: Carapeguá, Paraguarí, Villa Elisa, M. R. Alonso, Asunción, Concepción, María Auxiliadora Villeta, San Juan Nepomuceno, San Estanislao, San Pedro de Ycuamandyju, Belen, Cnel. Oviedo, Ciudad del Este, Caacupé, Pilar, San Ignacio, Cambyreta, Villa Elisa and San Lorenzo.
tag-11: The nominees were reviewed by a judging committee composed of Keisuke Ito, Director of Technical and Financial Cooperation at JICA; Juan Angel Bóveda, Director of Capyme (Small and Medium Enterprise Center); Eduardo Rotela, Country Head, Avina; and Alfredo Pajés, Vice President of Public and Corporate Relations at Citi Paraguay.
tag-12: In addition, two of last year's winners, Fabio Falcón (Fundación Paraguaya) and Susann de Casaccia (Interfisa), will travel to Buenos Aires, Argentina to participate in an international financial training seminar organized by Citi on November 11 to 15. Microentrepreneurs from several countries in the region will attend the training, which encourages sharing experiences to strengthen management skills.
tag-13: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-15: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
tag-16: Avina  Avina is a foundation that seeks to contribute to sustainable development in Latin America by promoting the creation of links and partnerships between social and business leaders and developing a consensus for action.
tag-17: Red de Microfinanzas  Red de Microfinanzas de Paraguay is an initiative aimed at organizing the microfinance industry by articulating the efforts of microfinance institutions in Paraguay.
